tournament.name: MIT Championship - Taiwan Crown Game Game - 10th Ring

decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts to build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. Utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal to generate mana and card advantage, along with powerful artifacts like Cranial Plating and Shadowspear to amplify the damage output of creatures. The inclusion of Urza's Saga enhances the artifact synergy, while cards like Tormod's Crypt and Engineered Explosives provide disruption against opposing strategies. The deck aims to win through fast and efficient aggression while leveraging the power of artifacts in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand using cards like Goryo's Vengeance, while also utilizing instant speed interaction and protection spells like Force of Negation and Ephemerate. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan early on with cards like Thoughtseize and Solitude, while setting up its own combo to quickly close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's diverse color requirements and the inclusion of cards like Prismatic Ending and Consign to Memory provide additional flexibility in dealing with threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Scion of Draco, Territorial Kavu, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. It also includes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Consign to Memory to control the board and protect its creatures. The inclusion of Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding helps to further strengthen the board presence and protect key creatures. The deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out games quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on using Amulet of Vigor to quickly ramp into Primeval Titan and other powerful creatures, while utilizing lands like Urza's Saga and Lotus Field for additional value. By assembling the right combination of lands and spells, the deck can generate massive amounts of mana and overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Malevolent Rumble and Aftermath Analyst. The deck also includes toolbox cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Summoner's Pact to find key pieces when needed. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficient land plays and explosive combos to dominate the game.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize creatures like Allosaurus Rider and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant to quickly assemble a powerful combo that can overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Eldritch Evolution and Neoform to tutor for key pieces, as well as Pact of Negation to protect the combo, this deck aims to win the game in a swift and explosive manner. Additionally, card draw and ramp spells like Disciple of Freyalise and Veil of Summer help to ensure consistency and resilience against disruption from the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing ramping effects like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to quickly generate the mana needed to play Primeval Titan and search for crucial lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures. By efficiently navigating the mana base and utilizing cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Scapeshift, the deck aims to assemble the necessary combo pieces to overwhelm opponents with powerful threats. The deck's unique mix of land-based interactions and combo potential makes it a formidable force in the Modern format.

This combo deck relies on using powerful creatures and spells to disrupt the opponent while setting up for a devastating finish with Goblin Charbelcher. By utilizing cards like Lotus Bloom and Whir of Invention to generate mana, as well as countermagic like Disrupting Shoal and Force of Negation to protect key pieces, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of land disruption cards like Jwari Disruption and Beyeen Veil helps to stall the opponent's game plan while the deck builds towards its explosive win condition.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast creatures and efficient burn spells, in order to close out the game quickly. It utilizes aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear alongside cheap and flexible spells like Lava Dart and Lightning Bolt to keep up the pressure. The deck also includes spells like Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge to pump up its creatures and push through damage. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck revolves around using Allosaurus Rider along with other creatures and spells to quickly assemble a powerful combo and win the game. By utilizing cards like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution, along with support cards like Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer for protection, the deck aims to quickly summon strong creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant or Griselbrand to overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to efficiently tutor and cheat out powerful creatures while controlling the game with disruptive spells and maintaining a strong board presence.

The deck focuses on utilizing a variety of creature toolbox options to assemble a powerful combo, with the key strategy revolving around sacrificing creatures for various effects and generating value through creature interactions. The deck includes several combo pieces and tutors like Chord of Calling to search for specific creatures, while also having a mix of ramp cards and lands to support the combo. The main goal is to create a synergistic board state that can overwhelm the opponent with powerful creature abilities and combos.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures. It combines elements of control with aggressive strategies to keep the opponent on the back foot. By using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's plays, along with creatures like Hydroelectric Specimen and Overlord of the Balemurk to apply pressure, the deck aims to control the board and overwhelm the opponent. The mana base is designed to support these strategies and allow for flexibility in casting spells.

This deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent's life total by casting cheap artifacts and creatures to overwhelm them. The key strategy is to play cards that benefit from having a high number of artifacts on the battlefield, such as Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary. The deck also includes disruption and control elements like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke to protect its aggressive game plan. Urza's Saga serves as a powerful engine to tutor for artifact threats, while Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal help to generate additional resources and mana.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the game through counter spells, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes powerful Planeswalkers like Narset and Teferi to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Wrath of the Skies to deal with threats on the board. By controlling the game and out-valuing the opponent, this deck aims to grind out a win through card advantage and powerful control elements.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with fast and aggressive creatures such as Dragon's Rage Channeler, Monastery Swiftspear, and Cori-Steel Cutter, backed up by a mix of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration provide card advantage, while Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge boost your creatures' power and toughness. The mana base is focused on efficient fetch lands to ensure consistency in casting your spells. The goal is to maintain pressure and finish the game quickly before your opponent can stabilize.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly deploy evasive threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, while supporting them with cheap spells like Lava Dart and Lightning Bolt to clear the way for damage. The deck aims to be fast and aggressive, using cards like Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge to pump up its creatures and close out the game quickly. The deck also features card draw and selection with cards like Expressive Iteration and Preordain to ensure it maintains pressure on the opponent.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruption spells to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly using Urza lands and Expedition Map, while also utilizing Karn, the Great Creator to shut down opponent's artifacts. The combination of Thought-Knot Seer and Devourer of Destiny provides hand disruption, while Glaring Fleshraker and Sire of Seven Deaths act as powerful threats. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures.
